marketNews.title: The Fed Cuts Interest Rates by 25 Bps, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content: The US central bank, The Fed, decided to cut interest rates by -25 bps to 4.5-4.75%, meeting the consensus expectation. This decision follows an interest rate cut of -50 bps in the previous meeting in September 2024. The Fed Chief, Jerome Powell, said that the Fed's interest rates are on the right path towards a neutral level, which neither stimulates nor restricts the economy. Powell mentioned that they are confident the inflation rate can sustainably decline towards the 2% target, while the labor market remains healthy despite broadly cooling down. Powell also said that the results of the US presidential election will not impact US monetary policy in the short term. The President-elect, Donald Trump, previously affirmed that he will allow Powell to continue serving as The Fed Chair until the end of his term in May 2026. Powell also stated that he would not resign if asked by Trump. Based on the September 2024 dot plot projections, The Fed officials anticipated that they would still cut interest rates by another -25 bps until the end of 2024, with further cuts totaling -100 bps during 2025. The Fed will only update its dot plot projections at the December 2024 meeting. Meanwhile, the market still expects The Fed to lower the benchmark interest rate by another -25 bps at the December 2024 meeting, although with a slightly decreasing probability from 82.7% to 74.7% after Trump's victory. Responding to the news of The Fed's interest rate cut, the three US stock exchange indices closed relatively stronger on Thursday (7/11), with the S&P 500 index rising +0.74%, Nasdaq surging +1.51%, and DJIA relatively flat at -0%. Previously, these three indices broke all-time high records after Trump won the election on Wednesday (6/11). Meanwhile, the US dollar index (DXY) weakened by -0.55% to the level of 104.5 on Thursday (7/11). Domestically, the IHSG closed higher by +0.6% today, Friday (8/11), but it was more driven by the rise in $BREN (+14.6%), $TPIA (+8.6%), and $AMMN (+3.5%). The IHSG recorded a net foreign outflow of 2.2 trillion rupiah today. Meanwhile, the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar strengthened by +0.41% to the level of 15,670, with the 10-year government bond yield falling -5 bps to the level of 6.74%. Key Takeaway: Generally, The Fed's interest rate cut on Thursday (7/11) was anticipated by the market, so it did not cause a dramatic market reaction. In the short term, we assess that Trump's victory will not immediately provide a significant impact on The Fed's interest rate policy. The market seems to be waiting to see the extent of implementation of the policies floated by Trump to gauge the impact on inflation and interest rate policy.

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Targets National Car Wholesale Sales to Reach 1 Million Units in 2025
marketNews.content: The Chairman of Gaikindo, Yohannes Nangoi, said that the association targets national car wholesale sales of 1 million units in 2025. Yohannes is optimistic that national car wholesale sales can return to the level of 1 million units per year in 2025 along with interest rate reductions and intensified electric vehicle charging infrastructure outside Java-Bali. Previously, Gaikindo downgraded the national car wholesale sales target for 2024 from 1.1 million units to 850,000 units, which is -15.5% lower than the 2023 realization of 1 million units. This target revision was based on the realization of national car wholesale sales which dropped -16.2% YoY during 9M24 to 633,218 units.

marketNews.title: Minister of SOEs Proposes Housing Loan Tenor be Extended to 30 Years
marketNews.content: Minister of SOEs, Erick Thohir, said that his ministry will encourage the tenor of housing ownership loans (KPR) to be extended from 15 years to 30 years. Erick mentioned that extending the KPR tenor is expected to make installment costs more affordable, thus helping the public own a home.

marketNews.title: Minister of ESDM Inaugurates Djoko Siswanto as Head of SKK Migas
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, inaugurated Djoko Siswanto as the head of SKK Migas, replacing Dwi Soetjipto. Previously, Djoko Siswanto served as the Secretary General of the National Energy Council since 2019. Bahlil mentioned that the main task of the new head of SKK Migas is to increase oil and gas lifting to realize President Prabowo Subianto's vision regarding energy sovereignty. To increase oil and gas lifting, Bahlil asked SKK Migas to coordinate with contractors to optimize idle wells that have not been processed. As of 1H24, realized oil lifting only reached 576.11 MBOPD or 90.73% of the 2024 State Budget target, with realized gas lifting only at 946.61 MBOEPD or 91.64% of the 2024 State Budget target.

marketNews.title: Launch of BPI Danantara Postponed Until President Prabowo Returns from Abroad
marketNews.content: The Head of the Nusantara Daya Anagata Investment Body (BPI Danantara), Muliaman Darmansyah Hadad, said that the launch of BPI Danantara will be postponed until President Prabowo Subianto returns from his overseas visit. The launch of Danantara was also postponed pending the completion of revisions to government regulations and presidential regulations. The Head of the Presidential Communication Office, Hasan Nasbi, said that President Prabowo requested the launch of BPI Danantara to be carried out with a careful process. Previously, Muliaman stated that President Prabowo Subianto would inaugurate BPI Danantara as the new manager of the state's wealth fund on November 7, 2024.

marketNews.title: Government to Transfer 7 SOEs to BPI Danantara
marketNews.content: Minister of SOEs, Erick Thohir, said that the government will transfer 7 SOEs to BPI Danantara. According to an IDX Channel report, these SOEs consist of Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Telkom Indonesia (TLKM), PT Perusahaan Listrik Negara, PT Pertamina, and PT Mineral Industri Indonesia or MIND ID.

marketNews.title: China Approves 6 Trillion Yuan Stimulus for Local Government Debt Refinancing
marketNews.content: The Chinese government on Friday (8/11) approved a stimulus package worth 6 trillion yuan (839 billion US dollars) to help local governments refinance debt. The stimulus will be implemented over the next 3 years until 2026, with an annual fund allocation of 2 trillion yuan. Additionally, the Chinese government also raised the limit for issuing special local government bonds from 29.52 trillion yuan (4.12 billion US dollars) to 35.52 trillion yuan (4.96 billion US dollars).

tickerNews.title: ANTM Signs Gold Purchase Agreement Worth $12.5 Billion from Freeport Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang signed a contract to purchase 30 tons of gold from PT Freeport Indonesia's smelter in Gresik, East Java. This contract, valued at 12.5 billion US dollars or 195.7 trillion rupiah, will last for 5 years. The President Director of PT Mineral Industri Indonesia (MIND ID), Hendi Prio Santoso, said that the synergy between the two companies will result in foreign exchange savings for the country.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Arranges $600 Million Loan from Six Banks
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Bank Negara Indonesia is currently arranging a loan facility worth 600 million US dollars with a 4-year tenor. Bloomberg sources mentioned that the loan originates from 6 banks: Bank of America Corp., CIMB Bank Bhd., CTBC Bank Co., DBS Group Holdings Ltd., HSBC Holdings Plc, and Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp. BBNI's Corporate Secretary, Okki Rushartomo, stated that the bank is seeking various sources for general funding and debt refinancing, without further detailing this specific loan.

tickerNews.title: CUAN Acquires 100% Stake in Subsidiary of PT Borneo Berkat Kutai
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi and its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jaya Persada, signed an agreement to acquire 100% of the shares of PT Borneo Berkat Kutai along with its subsidiary, PT Intan Bumi Persada, from PT Berkat Bumi Barito and Herry Hermawanto. The total transaction value was not announced. PT Intan Bumi Persada is a holder of a coal mining business license in Central Kalimantan. Following this transaction, CUAN becomes the direct owner of 100% of the shares in PT Borneo Berkat Kutai and the indirect owner of PT Intan Bumi Persada.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Targets Coal Beneficiation Pilot Project within Two Years until 2026
tickerNews.content: Bukit Asam's Corporate Secretary, Niko Chandra, said that the pilot project for converting coal into lithium-ion battery raw materials, namely artificial graphite and anode sheet, is expected to take 2 years until 2026. Niko mentioned that the estimated investment value for this project is still under study but is included in the company's long-term plan. This pilot project began in mid-2024 and is the result of collaboration with the National Research and Innovation Agency.

tickerNews.title: Minister of SOEs Asks Public to Await GIAA EGM Results Regarding Potential Board Changes
tickerNews.content: Minister of SOEs, Erick Thohir, asked the public to wait for the results of Garuda Indonesia's EGM on November 15, 2024, regarding the issue of changes in the airline's directors. Meanwhile, GIAA's President Director, Irfan Setiaputra, said that one of the agendas in this EGM will discuss the replacement of the board of directors and commissioners, although he could not confirm who would be replaced. Previously, Bloomberg reported that the Ministry of SOEs planned to replace the President Director position at GIAA as part of the government's efforts to increase profitability and support the company's expansion. Bloomberg sources mentioned that the Acting President Director of Lion Air, Wamildan Tsani Panjaitan, and GIAA's Finance Director, Prasetio, are potential candidates for the position.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Director Chi Hung Lee Increases Shareholding
tickerNews.content: Indosat Director, Chi Hung Lee, purchased 620,000 ISAT shares at an average price of 2,398 rupiah per share on November 1, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Chi Hung Lee's ownership in ISAT increased from 0% to 0.0019%.

tickerNews.title: AXIO to Distribute Interim Dividends for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Tera Data Indonusa will distribute interim dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 29.2 billion rupiah or 5 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated markets is November 15, 2024, with payment on December 6, 2024. Referring to AXIO's stock price at the market close on Friday (8/11) at 124 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 4.03%.

tickerNews.title: SOEs BMRI, BBRI, BBNI, and TLKM to be Transferred to BPI Danantara
tickerNews.content: Minister of SOEs, Erick Thohir, stated that the government will transfer 7 SOEs into BPI Danantara. According to an IDX Channel report, these SOEs consist of Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Telkom Indonesia (TLKM), PT Perusahaan Listrik Negara, PT Pertamina, and PT Mineral Industri Indonesia or MIND ID.

tickerNews.title: PEVE Controller PT Tancorp Mega Buana Increases Stake via Share Acquisition
tickerNews.content: The controller of Penta Valent (PEVE), PT Tancorp Mega Buana, purchased 423.8 (24%) million shares of PEVE from PT Maramakmur Selaras and PT Multi Pidotama Mandiri at a price of 265 rupiah per share on November 7, 2024. The total transaction value reached 112.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Tancorp Mega Buana's ownership in PEVE increased from 56% to 80%.

tickerNews.title: KMDS to Distribute Interim Dividends for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Kurniamitra Duta Sentosa (KMDS) will distribute interim dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 12 billion rupiah or 15 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated markets is November 15, 2024, with payment on November 29, 2024. Referring to KMDS's stock price at the market close on Friday (8/11) at 685 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 2.19%.

tickerNews.title: BUAH Director Renny Lauren Increases Shareholding
tickerNews.content: Segar Kumala Indonesia's (BUAH) President Director, Renny Lauren, purchased 732,600 BUAH shares at an average price of 1,600 rupiah per share on November 6, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Renny Lauren's ownership in BUAH increased from 0.97% to 1.05%.
